measured_by: drift-rate parameter of sequential sampling models (e.g., LBA, diffusion)
justification: The article notes that sequential sampling models "decompos[e] observed choices and latencies into latent components of processing including the speed of information processing," and later specifies that changes in "the parameter corresponding to the rate of accumulation – the drift rate" capture this effect.

measured_by: decision threshold / boundary parameter in sequential sampling models
justification: In Experiment 2 the authors report that the only parameter differing between speedy and careful conditions was "the decision thresholds," linking higher thresholds to more careful (i.e., more cautious) decisions.

The paper explains that "A multi-attribute DCE presents a set of two or more options that vary across two or more features or attributes, and asks the respondent to select their most preferred option," indicating the DCE is the instrument used to measure preferences among multi-attribute options.
